intro: Zigadenus fremontii var. salsus, commonly known as the fremont's death camas, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a toxic sap that contains various alkaloids. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care and avoid ingestion.
